required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Factors for Predicting Severe Asthma Exacerbators in Adult Asthmatics: A Real Word- Effectiveness Study
clinical_study.official_title: Factors for Predicting Severe Asthma Exacerbators in Adult Asthmatics: A Real Word- Effectiveness Study

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a single-center, retrospective, cross-sectional study. It plan to investigate the predictors for asthma exacerbation in long term follow up real world management with analyzing big data of electronic medical records (EMR).

detailed_description.textblock:
The long-term goals of asthma treatment are to achieve well control of symptoms and to minimize the future risk of asthma exacerbations (AEs). Asthma is a heterogeneous disease with various responses to treatment and clinical outcomes. AEs are a prominent feature of severe asthmatics; however, frequent AEs have also been reported in mild asthmatics.
This is a prospectively designed observational study to identify predictors for patients with frequent AEs among adult asthmatics by analyzing medical big data of electronic medical records (EMR), which will provide an insight in the long-term management of adult asthmatics in real-world practice.

primary_outcome.measure: Identifying prognostic factors for risk of severe asthma exacerbation
primary_outcome.description: Identifying prognostic factors for risk of severe asthma exacerbation

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluating total IgE (KU/L) to predict severe asthma exacerbation
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluating total IgE (KU/L) to predict severe asthma exacerbation

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluating peripheral eosiniphil, neutrophil, basophil and lymphocyte counts to predict severe asthma exacerbation
secondary_outcome.description: Unit of peripheral eosiniphil, neutrophil, basophil and lymphocyte counts: ×10³/uL

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluating ECP (ug/L) to predict severe asthma exacerbation
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluating ECP (ug/L) to predict severe asthma exacerbation

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluating sputum eosinophils (%) to predict severe asthma exacerbation
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluating sputum eosinophils (%) to predict severe asthma exacerbation

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluating FEV1 (%) and FEV1/FVC (%) to predict severe asthma exacerbation
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluating FEV1 (%) and FEV1/FVC (%) to predict severe asthma exacerbation

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparing clinical characteristics according to the frequency of severe asthma exacerbation
secondary_outcome.description: Comparing clinical characteristics according to the frequency of severe asthma exacerbation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the initial 2 years and the following 3-10 years of treatment

study_pop.textblock: Patients aged ≥17 years diagnosed as having bronchial asthma (with J45-J46 code of International classification of Diseases, 10th edition on EMR) and who had been treated by allergy or respiratory specialists at Ajou University Hospital from January 1995 to June 2018

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Aged ≥17 years
- Patients having bronchial asthma with J45-J46 code of International classification of Diseases (10th edition on EMR)
- Asthmatics who had been treated by allergy or respiratory specialists
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who has less than one year for asthma treatment
